document_data.name: Zrumya
document_data.mainbody:
'''Zrumya''' was a [[giant bat]] who worked in the general store that belonged to [[Ibn Engaruka]] of [[Port Castigliar]], in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''Zrumya! Pick up in row two, level six!''|[[Inyanga Engaruka]]}}
document_data.Description: Zrumya was a well-trained giant [[bat]] about the size of an adult [[human]]. The bat could understand instructions given to it by Inyanga. Zrumya moved and carried the store's boxed goods using the claws located on its wing joints. The dire bat had a bundle strapped to its chest to move goods around the shelves and hard-to-access storage places to help with its duties. Zrumya's skittering on the store floor and high walls of boxes reminded observers of a moving [[spider]]. When not working, Zrumya could be found on its perch inside the general store.
document_data.Relationships: Zrumya was a loyal guardian of the young shopkeeper's son, Inyanga Engaruka, helping the child maintain the store, and defended him fearlessly if Inyanga was ever threatened.
document_data.History: In [[1362 DR]],{{Cite web/Presenting...Seven Millennia of Realms Fiction}} [[Artus Cimber]] and [[Hydel Pontifax]] encountered Zrumya and its young master Inyanga Engaruka when they traveled to Chult in search of the fabled ''[[Ring of Winter]]''.
